newsitem.title: EGYPT: Iran's Velayati in Cairo on landmark visit.
newsitem.headline: Iran's Velayati in Cairo on landmark visit.

text.p: Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati arrived in Cairo on Monday for the first high-level meeting between Egypt and Iran since Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak accused Tehran of trying to kill him in 1995.
Airport officials said Velayati was met at Cairo airport by Egyptian Foreign Minister Amr Moussa and officials said the two men were expected to hold formal talks later on Monday.
The Iranian official is also due to meet Mubarak on Tuesday to invite him to a Islamic conference to be held in Iran in December, Egyptian officials said.
Ties between Cairo and Tehran have been strained for years over policy differences.

Egypt has accused Iran and Sudan of continuing support for the al-Gama'a al-Islamiya (Islamic Group), the largest organisation fighting to set up a strict Islamic state in Egypt. Both Sudan and Iran deny this.
Iran was also accused of being behind the attempted assassination of Mubarak during the Egyptian leader's visit to Ethiopia in 1995.
Velayati last visited Cairo in 1994 to attend a Non-Aligned Movement meeting of foreign ministers.
